intro: Bupleurum apiculatum f. orphanidesii, commonly known as the Orphanides' bellflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often complex inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in mountainous environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with a distinctive, bell-shaped structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
